column4: Hello can i get some help with my screen resolution i think its only 1024x768 but my laptop is designed to be 1920x1440 can anyone offer any suggestions, i have tried 915resolution but for some reason its not writing to my xorg.conf is it safe to just change the resolution in xorg.conf?
my card is an intel, hence there is no res of 1920x1440 written into the bios so that if i want higher resolution is must force it, have i been misled?
ok i will try and be back
i think 1920x1440 is beyond the hardware limits of the intel cards. you won't get that resolution even if you patch it into the bios.
which particular intel gfx card is it?
i think the i945GM can do 1600x1200 max. and only at 16bpp color depth. lower resolutions can have 24bpp.
but i'm not 100% sure
anyway, if you need to patch modes in the bios, you need to install the 915resolution package
i just found out i can use 1920 1440
good. at which color depth?
doesnt say i assume its crappy, can you suggets a good resolution to try for this laptop? so its not so blury on screen
i don't even know which laptop you have
sorry acer travelmate 2480 i guess i should just try 1440 900
try  sudo vbetool vbefp panelsize  to detect the size of the tft panel
just in case you don't know the native resolution of the tft
then configure this resolution for X
done im going to try to restart x
beryl doesn't seem to work at this res though =( too laggy would that be right?
i don't use beryl, cannot help you with that
what was the command to reconfigure the xserv again
